title: A Prayer for Mercy
shortSummary: Psalm 6 is a heartfelt plea from David for God's mercy and healing amid deep distress and suffering. It reveals the psalmist's anguish, repentance, and confident trust that God hears and will answer prayer. This chapter teaches believers how to approach God in times of trouble with humility and faith.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this psalm, a king of Israel, expressing his personal anguish and seeking God's mercy and deliverance.

keyCharacters.name: Workers of Iniquity
keyCharacters.description: The enemies or evildoers who oppose David and from whom he seeks deliverance.

definitions.definition: Musical instruments, likely stringed, used in worship; indicates the psalm was set to music.
To discipline or correct, often through suffering, with the intent of bringing about repentance and growth.
A musical term possibly indicating an eight-stringed instrument or a style of music used in the temple worship.
A humble and earnest prayer or request to God.

outline.heading: David's Plea for Mercy and Healing
outline.description: David begins by asking God not to rebuke him in anger but to have mercy and heal him, expressing his physical and spiritual weakness and distress.

outline.heading: Prayer for Deliverance and Remembrance
outline.description: David implores God to return and save his soul, recognizing that death ends the opportunity to praise God.

outline.heading: Expression of Deep Sorrow
outline.description: The psalmist describes his intense grief and sleepless nights, overwhelmed by enemies and sorrow.

outline.heading: Confidence in God's Hearing and Justice
outline.description: David declares that God has heard his weeping and prayer, and he calls for his enemies to be ashamed and defeated.

application: Approach God with humility and repentance when facing trials, acknowledging our need for His mercy and healing.
Persist in prayer even in deep distress, trusting that God hears and will respond to sincere supplication.
Recognize the seriousness of sin and the consequences of death apart from God, motivating a life of faith and obedience.
Take comfort that God is attentive to the cries of His people and will bring justice against the wicked.

keyVerses.text: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the psalmistâ€™s urgent plea for God's mercy and healing in times of weakness.

keyVerses.text: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?
keyVerses.significance: It reminds believers of the finality of death and the importance of praising God while alive.

keyVerses.text: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.
keyVerses.significance: This verse expresses confident assurance that God listens to and answers the prayers of His people.
